Name: Yahagi
Fate:
Sunk 7 April 1945 by USN aircraft south of Kyūshū
30°47′N 128°08′E﻿ / ﻿30.783°N 128.133°E﻿ / 30.783; 128.133
Displacement: 6,652 t (6,547 long tons) (standard); 7,590 t (7,470 long tons) (loaded)
Propulsion:
4 shaft Gihon geared turbines
6 Kampon boilers
100,000 shp
Range: 6,300 nautical miles (11,670 km) at 18 knots (33 km/h)
Armament:
6 × 152 mm Type 41 guns (3 × 2)
4 × 8cm/60 Type 98 naval guns (2x2),
2 × triple Type 96 25 mm AA guns,
2 × twin 13 mm machine guns
8 × 610 mm torpedo tubes (4x2)
48 naval mines
Armor:
Belt 60 mm (2.4 in)
Deck 20 mm (0.79 in)
